style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">PURCHASE, N.Y. - July&#160;17, 2025</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> - PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ&#58; PEP) today reported results for the second quarter 2025. </font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8220;We&#8217;re encouraged by the acceleration in our net revenue growth versus the previous quarter with our businesses effectively navigating through a challenging environment.  Our international business momentum continued, while our North America businesses improved their execution and competitiveness in key subcategories and channels,&#8221; said Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Laguarta continued, &#8220;As we look ahead, we will continue to build upon the successful expansion and growth of our International business and accelerate initiatives to improve our North America business performance. These initiatives include more portfolio innovation and cost optimization activities that aim to stimulate growth and profitability. As a result, for fiscal 2025, we remain confident in our ability to deliver low-single-digit organic revenue growth with core constant currency EPS to be approximately even with the prior year. Our core USD EPS outlook has improved versus our previous expectations as foreign exchange headwinds have moderated, due to the weakening of the U.S. dollar.&#8221;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:4pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">1 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Please refer to the Glossary for the definitions of non-GAAP financial measures, including &#8220;Organic revenue performance,&#8221; &#8220;Core&#8221; and &#8220;Constant currency,&#8221; and to &#8220;Guidance and Outlook&#8221; for additional information regarding PepsiCo&#8217;s full-year 2025 financial guidance. PepsiCo provides guidance on a non-GAAP basis as we cannot predict certain elements which are included in reported GAAP results, including the impact of foreign exchange and commodity mark-to-market net impacts. Please refer to PepsiCo&#8217;s Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the 12 and 24 weeks ended June&#160;14, 2025 (Q2 2025 Form 10-Q) filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for additional information regarding PepsiCo&#8217;s financial results.</font></div><div style="height:24.75pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">2</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;border-bottom:1pt solid style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(5)</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">(a)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:7.02pt">Excludes the impact of acquisitions and divestitures. In certain instances, the volume change shown here differs from the impact of organic volume change on net revenue performance disclosed in the Organic Revenue Performance table on page A-7, due to the impacts of product mix, nonconsolidated joint venture volume, and, for our franchise beverage businesses, temporary timing differences between bottler case sales (BCS) and concentrate shipments and equivalents (CSE). We report net revenue from our franchise beverage businesses based on CSE. The volume sold by our nonconsolidated joint ventures has no direct impact on our net revenue.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Note&#58; Amounts may not sum due to rounding.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Organic revenue and core constant currency results are non-GAAP financial measures. Please refer to the reconciliation of GAAP and non-GAAP information in the attached exhibits and to the Glossary for definitions of &#8220;Organic revenue performance,&#8221; &#8220;Core&#8221; and style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">(a)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:7.02pt">Excludes the impact of acquisitions and divestitures. In certain instances, the volume change shown here differs from the impact of organic volume on net revenue performance disclosed in the Organic Revenue Performance tables on page A-7, due to the impacts of product mix, nonconsolidated joint venture volume, and, for our franchise beverage businesses, temporary timing differences between BCS and CSE. We report net revenue from our franchise beverage businesses based on CSE. The volume sold by our nonconsolidated joint ventures has no direct impact on our net revenue.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Note&#58; Amounts may not sum due to rounding.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Organic revenue and core constant currency results are non-GAAP financial measures. Please refer to the reconciliation of GAAP and non-GAAP information in the attached exhibits and to the Glossary for definitions of &#8220;Organic revenue performance,&#8221; &#8220;Core&#8221; and &#8220;Constant currency.&#8221;</font></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:6.75pt;padding-right:6.75pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">3</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:center;text-indent:36pt"><font><br></font></div></div></div><div id="i05a1a71303b5430f8a967f7e7dddd9bf_13"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Guidance and Outlook</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The Company provides guidance on a non-GAAP basis as we cannot predict certain elements which are included in reported GAAP results, including the impact of foreign exchange translation and commodity mark-to-market net impacts.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">For 2025, the Company continues to expect&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.15pt">A low-single-digit increase in organic revenue&#59; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.15pt">Core constant currency EPS to be approximately even with the prior year&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.15pt">A core annual effective tax rate of approximately 20 percent&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.15pt">Total cash returns to shareholders of approximately $8.6 billion, comprised of dividends of $7.6 billion and share repurchases of $1.0 billion.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The Company now expects a foreign exchange translation headwind of approximately 1.5-percentage-points to negatively impact reported net revenue and core EPS growth (previously an approximate 3-percentage-point headwind), based on current market consensus rates.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">This assumption and the guidance above implies a 1.5 percent decline in core EPS in 2025 (previously a 3 percent decline in core EPS) compared to 2024 core EPS of $8.16.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Prepared Management Remarks and Live Question and Answer Webcast</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">At approximately 6&#58;30 a.m. (Eastern time) on July&#160;17, 2025, the Company will post prepared management remarks (in pdf format) of its second quarter 2025 results and business update, including its outlook for 2025, at </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">https&#58;&#47;&#47;www.pepsico.com&#47;investors</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">. At 8&#58;15 a.m. (Eastern time) on July&#160;17, 2025, the Company will host a live question and answer session with investors and financial analysts. Further details will be accessible on the Company&#8217;s website at </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">https&#58;&#47;&#47;www.pepsico.com&#47;investors</font><font Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">18,171&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#ffffff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt 2px 37pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:top"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Total Liabilities and Equity</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">105,345&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:0 1pt"></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">99,467&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr></table></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#160;</font></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">A - 4</font></div></div></div><div id="i05a1a71303b5430f8a967f7e7dddd9bf_34"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:42.75pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:14pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;text-decoration:underline">Non-GAAP Measures</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">In discussing financial results and guidance, the Company refers to the following measures which are not in accordance with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)&#58; organic revenue performance, core results and core constant currency results. We use non-GAAP financial measures internally to make operating and strategic decisions, including the preparation of our annual operating plan, evaluation of our overall business performance and as a factor in determining compensation for certain employees.&#160;We believe presenting non-GAAP financial measures provides additional information to facilitate comparison of our historical operating results and trends in our underlying operating results and provides additional transparency on how we evaluate our business.&#160;We also believe presenting these measures allows investors to view our performance using the same measures that we use in evaluating our financial and business performance and trends. </font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">We consider quantitative and qualitative factors in assessing whether to adjust for the impact of items that may be significant or that could affect an understanding of our ongoing financial and business performance or trends.&#160;Examples of items for which we may make adjustments include&#58; amounts related to mark-to-market gains or losses (non-cash)&#59; charges related to restructuring plans&#59; charges associated with acquisitions and divestitures&#59; gains associated with divestitures&#59; asset impairment charges (non-cash)&#59; product recall-related impact&#59; pension and retiree medical-related amounts, including all settlement and curtailment gains and losses&#59; charges or adjustments related to the enactment of new laws, rules or regulations, such as tax law changes&#59; amounts related to the resolution of tax positions&#59; tax benefits related to reorganizations of our operations&#59; debt redemptions, cash tender or exchange offers&#59; and remeasurements of net monetary assets. See below for a description of adjustments to our GAAP financial measures included herein.&#160;</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Non-GAAP information should be considered as supplemental in nature and is not meant to be considered in isolation or as a substitute for the related financial information prepared in accordance with GAAP. In addition, our non-GAAP financial measures may not be the same as or comparable to similar non-GAAP measures presented by other companies.</font></div><div style="margin-top:14pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;text-decoration:underline">Glossary</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">We use the following definitions when referring to our non-GAAP financial measures, which may not be the same as or comparable to similar measures presented by other companies&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Acquisitions and divestitures&#58; mergers and acquisition activity, as well as divestitures and other structural changes, including changes in ownership or control in consolidated subsidiaries and nonconsolidated equity investees.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Bottler case sales (BCS)&#58; Measure of physical beverage volume shipped to retailers and independent distributors from both PepsiCo and our independent bottlers.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Concentrate shipments and equivalents (CSE)&#58; Measure of our physical beverage volume shipments to independent bottlers.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Constant currency&#58; Financial results assuming constant foreign currency exchange rates used for translation based on the rates in effect for the comparable prior-year period. In order to compute our constant currency results, we multiply or divide, as appropriate, our current-year U.S. dollar results by the current-year average foreign exchange rates and then multiply or divide, as appropriate, those amounts by the prior-year average foreign exchange rates. Beginning with our first quarter of 2025, on a prospective basis, we are also applying the constant currency calculation for our subsidiaries operating in highly inflationary economies.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Core&#58; Core results are non-GAAP financial measures which exclude certain items from our financial results. For further information regarding these excluded items, refer to &#8220;Items Affecting Comparability&#8221; in &#8220;Item 2 &#8211; Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; in our Q2 2025 Form 10-Q and in &#8220;Item 7 &#8211; Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; in Exhibit 99.2 to our separate Current Report on Form 8-K dated July 17, 2025, in which we recast historical segment reporting to reflect our current organizational structure. For the periods presented, core results exclude the following items&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Mark-to-market net impact</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Mark-to-market net gains and losses on commodity derivatives in corporate unallocated expenses. These gains and losses are subsequently reflected in segment results when the segments recognize the cost of the underlying commodity in operating profit. </font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;padding-left:9pt;padding-right:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Restructuring and impairment charges</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Expenses related to the multi-year productivity plan publicly announced in 2019 (2019 Productivity Plan), which was expanded and extended through the end of 2030 to take advantage of additional opportunities within the initiatives of the plan.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Acquisition and divestiture-related charges</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Acquisition and divestiture-related charges primarily include transaction expenses, such as consulting, advisory and other professional fees, and merger and integration charges. Merger and integration charges include distribution agreement termination fees, employee-related costs, closing costs and other integration costs.</font></div><div style="height:42.75pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">A - 5</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:42.75pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Impairment and other charges</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">We recognized impairment charges as a result of our quantitative assessments of certain of our indefinite-lived intangible assets, primarily related to the Rockstar and Be &#38; Cheery brands</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. In addition, we recognized charges related </font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">to the impairment of our investment in Tropicana Brands Group (TBG) and r</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">ecorded allowance for expected credit losses related to outstanding receivables from TBG associated with the sale of Tropicana, Naked and other select juice brands.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Product recall-related impact</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">We recognized property, plant and equipment and inventory write-offs, employee severance costs, product returns, customer and consumer-related costs and other costs in our PFNA segment associated with a previously announced voluntary recall of certain bars and cereals.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Indirect tax impact</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">We recognized additional expenses related to an indirect tax reserve in our IB Franchise segment.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Pension and retiree medical-related impact</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Pension and retiree medical-related impact primarily includes settlement charges due to lump sum distributions to retired or terminated employees and the purchase of a group annuity contract whereby a third-party insurance company assumed the obligation to pay and administer future benefit payments for certain retirees. The settlement charge was triggered when the aggregate of the cumulative lump sum distributions and the annuity contract premium exceeded the total annual service and interest costs. Pension and retiree medical-related impact also includes curtailment gains and losses due to restructuring actions as part of our 2019 Productivity Plan.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Effective net pricing&#58; Reflects the year-over-year impact of discrete pricing actions, sales incentive activities and mix resulting from selling varying products in different package sizes and in different countries.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Organic revenue performance&#58; A measure that adjusts for the impacts of foreign exchange translation (on a constant currency basis, as defined above), acquisitions and divestitures, and every five or six years, the impact of an additional week of results. Beginning with our first quarter of 2025, on a prospective basis, we are also applying the constant currency calculation for our subsidiaries operating in highly inflationary economies. We believe organic revenue performance provides useful information in evaluating the results of our business because it adjusts for items that we believe are not indicative of ongoing performance or that we believe impact comparability with the prior year. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">2025 guidance</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Our 2025 organic revenue performance guidance adjusts for the impacts of foreign exchange translation (on a constant currency basis, as defined above) and acquisitions and divestitures. Our 2025 core effective tax rate guidance and our 2025 core constant currency EPS growth guidance exclude the mark-to-market net impact included in corporate unallocated expenses, restructuring and impairment charges and other items noted above. Our 2025 core constant currency EPS growth guidance also excludes the impact of foreign exchange translation. We are unable to reconcile our full year projected 2025 organic revenue growth to our full year projected 2025 reported net revenue growth because we are unable to predict the 2025 impact of foreign exchange due to the unpredictability of future changes in foreign exchange rates and because we are unable to predict the occurrence or impact of any acquisitions, divestitures or other structural changes. We are also not able to reconcile our full year projected 2025 core effective tax rate to our full year projected 2025 reported effective tax rate and our full year projected 2025 core constant currency EPS growth to our full year projected 2025 reported EPS growth because we are unable to predict the 2025 impact of foreign exchange or the mark-to-market net impact on commodity derivatives due to the unpredictability of future changes in foreign exchange rates and commodity prices. Therefore, we are unable to provide a reconciliation of these measures.</font></div><div style="height:42.75pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">A - 6</font></div></div></div><div Performance, which is a financial measure that is not in accordance with GAAP. See pages A-5 through A-6 for further discussion.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">(c)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:4.63pt">A financial measure that is not in accordance with GAAP. See pages A-5 through A-6 for further discussion.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">(d)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:4.18pt">Excludes the impact of acquisitions and divestitures. In certain instances, the impact of organic volume change on net revenue performance differs from the unit volume change disclosed in the Summary Second-Quarter 2025 Performance table and Summary Year-to-Date Performance on pages 2 and 3, respectively, due to the impacts of product mix, nonconsolidated joint venture volume, and, for our franchise beverage businesses, temporary timing differences between BCS and CSE. We report net revenue from our franchise beverage businesses based on CSE. The volume sold by our nonconsolidated joint ventures has no direct impact on our net revenue.</font></div><div style="text-indent:4.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font tax laws and income tax rates applicable to the underlying item in its corresponding tax jurisdiction.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font the effective tax rate resulting from a higher or lower tax rate as applicable to the items affecting comparability.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">(a)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:4.18pt">Provision for income taxes is the expected tax charge&#47;benefit on the underlying item based on the tax laws and income tax rates applicable to the underlying item in its corresponding tax jurisdiction.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:4.18pt">The impact of items affecting comparability on our effective tax rate represents the difference in the effective tax rate resulting from a higher or lower tax rate as applicable to the items affecting comparability.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:4.63pt">A financial measure that is not in accordance with GAAP. <TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>10
<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
.report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

	margin-top: 0px;
}

	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

	background-color: #2F4497;
}

	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

	font-size: 1em;
}

	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}
